content: >http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jV3NzheAMWCS0RyfFTUjG1Vc8kPwD97KE9K02 Bolivian security forces killed three and captured two members of what they are claiming was a European 'hit' squad targetting President Evo Morales as well some of his political opponents. The squad, neutalized after a gun battle at a hotel in Santa Cruz, included Bolivians with European connections, veterans of the Balkans and one Irishman from Tipperary.
reply: >http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5jV3NzheAMWCS0RyfFTUjG1Vc8kPwD97KE9K02 Bolivian security forces killed three and captured two members of what they are claiming was a European 'hit' squad targetting President Evo Morales as well some of his political opponents. The squad, neutalized after a gun battle at a hotel in Santa Cruz, included Bolivians with European connections, veterans of the Balkans and one Irishman from Tipperary.
title: Bolivians Kill, Capture 'Hit Squad'

content: Interestingly I caught part of a televised production that included that Bolivia is believed to have 70 to 80% of the worlds known supply of Lithium. Lithium is becomeing increasingly imortant with advances in battery tech for automobiles and computerized equipment. I understand that Bolivia is holding off on pressure from the industrialized world until they have a good undertanding of this and want the concession that E cars will be manufactured in Bolivia. I am not saying the hit squad is related to Bolivia's current Lithium policy but 70 to 80% of the world supply is a notable amount.
